intro: Yulania dimorpha, commonly known as the Shasta daisy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, white ray florets surrounding a central disk of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and its tolerance to drought conditions. Yulania dimorpha is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
